page.title: 05HOUSING IN COLYTON
page.content: Colyton is a very old village with most of the houses being 500-600 years old. There are many interesting houses in Colyton, the biggest being Colyton House which stands in the centre of Colyton. It is surrounded by a 15-20ft wall. Another interesting house is the Vicarage which dates from the 16th Century. Near the church there are several old workers' cottages,some of them dating back to at least the 17th Century. Most of the houses are made of local stone, as are the older farmhouses in the area. Another interesting old house is Oroolong House in Queen Street, the home of Captain Wilson, the discoverer of the Pelew Islands. Several houses are thatched. In recent years, 5 housing estates have been built on the outskirts of Colyton. A typical 3 bedroomed semi costs Â£35-40,000.
